reviews.review_msg: She will assign a minimum of seven readings per lecture. She is very vocal towards students who are disruptive during class. The TA literally saved this course.
Don't be disruptive in class and listen in lecture very well. Always communicate with the prof and the TAs if you need help.

POL 445 on American Foreign Policy was a fresh departure from the usual topics found in the poli sci department. Lectures were dense but interesting, fair amount of reading, assigned a book instead of textbook. Really sweet prof, always available for help. Learnt so much useful material. Security and power relation focused which is great

Though the course readings were interesting and diverse, topic-wise, her lectures oftentimes focused more heavily on specific topics of interest to her, like security and especially the military. Marking was kind of inconsistent, probably because she's a new prof. The exam was very lengthy, but doable, and heavily based on readings.
